description: Use the attributes given below to render a dashed trend line instead of the continuous line:

title: Add Slanted Trend Lines
description: Use the following attributes to render a slanted trend line:

title: Configure the Trend Line Label
description: Show the trend line label to the right of the chart canvas by setting the value of valueOnRight attribute to 1.

title: Add Trend Lines for a Dual Y-axis Chart
description: Since a dual y-axis chart has 2 y-axes, you need to define both the trend line and the axis on which the line will be defined. Set the value of the parentYAxis attribute of the line object to S, to show the trend line on the secondary axis.

title: Anchors and Lines
description: Anchors help to identify the data point better in the chart. They also show a tooltip showing the data plot details when the mouse is hovered over them

title: Hide Anchors
description: By default, the anchors and their corresponding tooltips are displayed. To hide the anchors set the drawAnchors attribute to 0 as shown in the code below:

title: Customize Anchor Properties
description: To customize the properties of the anchors, the following attributes are used:

title: Customize Anchors for specific Data Points
description: To highlight a specific anchor, customize the cosmetics for only that particular anchor.

title: Add External Images
description: You can add external images in place of anchors for line and area charts. This allows you to use different images for each anchor and lets you highlight special values. To do so, you have to set the attributes in individual data object. The attributes used are:

title: Cross Line
description: Cross line is a vertical line/area used as quick reference for the data plots. The tooltip that appears is consolidated with all the information required.

title: Show/Hide the Cross Line
description: By default, the cross line is turned off. To show the crossline set the drawCrossLine attribute to 1. Refer to the code below:

title: Customize Cross Line Color
description: Specify the hex code of the cross line color using the crossLineColor attribute. Refer to the code below:

title: Set Tooltip Background Color
description: A tooltip is a common element, used to display information whenever you hover over a particular data point. A consolidated tooltip has been introduced with the cross line which can be used to get the detailed information of the hovered plots in a multi-series chart.

title: Customize Tooltip Border
description: To customize the tooltip border, the following attributes are used:

title: Set Separator Character for Tooltip
description: Specify the character to separate the name and the value displayed in the tooltip using the toolTipSepChar attribute. Refer to the code below:

title: Show/Hide Tooltip Shadow
description: By default, the tooltip shadow is visible. To hide the tooltip shadow set the showTooltipShadow attribute to 0. Refer to the code below:

title: Tooltips
description: A tooltip is displayed when the mouse is hovered over a particular data point. This article talk about customizing the tooltip.

title: Show/Hide Tooltips
description: By default, the tooltip is displayed. To hide the tool tip set the showToolTip attribute to 0.

title: Customize Tooltips
description: To customize the tooltip use the following attributes:

title: Display Multiline Tooltip Text
description: By default, a tooltip shows the data item name and value in a single line of text. However, if you want to display more information on the tooltip, you can use the attribute tooltext to show the text in multiline format.

title: Introduction to Macros
description: FusionCharts Suite XT 3.4 introduces macros to configure dynamic and contextual content in tooltips. A macro is an instruction recorded using a combination of characters for a specific purpose.

title: Vertical Lines
description: Vertical separator lines or vlines are elements that can differentiate between data blocks in a chart. They can be placed between any two data points

title: Set Vertical Lines
description: By default, the vertical lines do not appear. To display a vertical line follow the steps below:

title: Show Label Borders
description: To add borders to the label set the showVLineLabelBorder to 1 within the chart object. This attribute is used to show borders for the labels of all the vertical lines.

title: Customize Visual Properties
description: To customize the visual properties of the vertical line, the following attributes are used:

title: Legend
description: A legend is a chart element that is used to display the series name of each dataset in multi-series/combination charts

title: Show/Hide the Legends
description: To show/hide the legends, set the showLegend attribute to 1/0. The default value of this attribute is 1.

title: Show/Hide Data Plots via the Legend
description: With FusionCharts Suite XT, show/hide the data plots belonging to a data series by clicking the corresponding legend icon. The legend interaction can also be disabled using interactiveLegend attribute. The default value of this attribute is 1. Let's check out a sample without the interactive legend.

title: Highlight a Data Series via the Legend
description: Hover the mouse pointer over a legend text to highlight corresponding data plots in the chart. Whenever you do this, the chart reduces the opacity of the data plots belonging to other data series, making the one you hover on stand out prominently.

title: Set the Legend Position
description: Use the following attributes to set legend position:

title: Configure Legend Icon Size
description: Specify the legend icon size using the legendIconScale attribute. You can control the size of legend icon with values from 1 (100%) to 5 (500%).

title: Draw a Custom Legend Icon Shape
description: Use the following attributes to draw a custom legend icon shape:

title: Customize Legend Scroll Bar
description: If you have multiple data items in a multi-series chart, the legend automatically displays a scroll bar. Use the legendScrollBgColor attribute to specify the background color of the scroll bar.

title: Reverse Legend Order
description: Set the value of reverseLegend attribute to 1, to reverse the order of datasets in the legend.

title: Hide Data Series upon Loading
description: Set the value of initiallyHiddenattribute to 1, to hide the data plots of a data series initially, on chart load. The plots will become visible when you click on the name of the series in the legend. This attribute works from the dataset object level in JSON data, and by default takes the value of 0, thereby displaying data plots of every series when you load the chart.

title: Customize Legend Appearance
description: Use the following attributes used to customize legend appearance:

title: Customize Legend Font Cosmetics
description: Use the following attributes to customize the legend font cosmetics:

title: Annotations
description: Annotations are user-defined objects or shapes drawn on a chart. Annotations are often required to make interpretation of the chart easy for the end user.

title: How Annotations Work
description: Annotations are defined inside the annotations object. This object has an array of groups, and each group element has a unique id. The groups object contains an array of items, each of which contains information on one specific annotation in the chart.

title: Use Objects to Create Annotations
description: Use the following objects to create annotations:

title: Add Different types of Annotations
description: You can add the following types of annotations to your chart:

title: Create Text Annotations
description: Use the following attributes to text annotations, to add notes, labels, or any other contextual text information to charts.

title: Create Image Annotations
description: Use the following attributes to create image annotations:

title: Create Shape Annotations
description: You can draw annotations in any of the following shapes using FusionCharts Suite XT:

title: Adhoc Attributes
description: Rectangle

title: Positioning Annotations
description: You can configure positions of annotations either during their creation or after rendering them on a chart/gauge. Position annotation items by setting the positioning attributes (x, y, toX, toY, radius, and so on) to the required coordinates.

title: Absolute Values
description: In this section, you will see how to position annotations using static values. The attributes used to position annotations are as follows:

title: Use Macros
description: Annotation macros are predefined variables you can use to dynamically position individual annotation items. Since macros assume values at runtime, you can use them with all annotation positioning attributes. That way, you can position annotations relative to chart/gauge elements, such as caption, legend, etc. For example, for an annotation item, if you set "x": "$captionStartX", x will take the value of the starting x-coordinate of the chart caption.

title: Group annotations
description: You can group a number of annotation items together as one item. This is useful when there are multiple annotations on a chart and you have to configure common properties for all of them.

title: Dynamically control annotations
description: You can use methods available within FusionCharts Suite XT to create, update, set the visibility of, and delete annotation groups and items at runtime, with the FusionCharts API. This is especially helpful when you want to augment your charts with context sensitive information. For instance, you can show, hide, or update the color for an annotation group or item using the respective methods.

title: Real life use cases
description: In the examples given below, you can see how annotations can be used in different scenarios.

title: Create a Collaborative Dashboard
description: Click here to see a collaborative dashboard that is a complex and practical example of how to use annotations, to add more information to a chart.

title: Annotation references
description: In the following sections, you can see an exhaustive set of attributes and macros supported by annotations in FusionCharts Suite XT.

description: You can use the following attributes with the root annotations object, to globally configure generic aspects of annotations:

description: You can uniformly configure all annotation items contained within an annotation group, by using a number of attributes, as detailed in the list below. Group attributes inherit default values from the ones defined as root-level annotation attributes.

title: Tick Marks
description: Tick marks in gauges are calibration marks to help interpret reading. One show/hide tick marks,show tick mark values in decimals or show nth tick mark value

title: Show/Hide Tick Marks
description: By default, the tick marks are displayed. To hide the tick marks set the showTickMarks attribute to 1. Refer to the code below:

title: Show/Hide the Tick Values
description: By default, the tick values are displayed. To hide the tick values set the showTickValues attribute to 1. Refer to the code below:

title: Configure the Tick Value Position
description: By default, tick marks and tick values are placed outside a gauge. In vertical gauges (like the vertical LED gauge), they are placed to the right of the gauge by default. Similarly, in horizontal gauges (like the horizontal LED gauge), they are placed below the gauge.

title: Display every nth Tick Mark Value
description: FusionCharts allows you to show every n-th value, where the upper and lower limit of the scale is always displayed.

title: Show Tick Values in Decimals
description: You can configure the number of decimals and can also force the number of decimals on tick values.

title: Configure Tick Mark and Tick Value Padding
description: By defining the padding for tick mark and tick value, you can control the amount of space between the tick mark and the gauge, or between the tick values and tick marks.

title: Set the Number of Major and Minor Tick Marks
description: By default, the number of major and minor ticks are automatically adjusted. You can opt to define the number of major and minor tick marks to be rendered on a gauge. To do so, the following attributes are used:

title: Configure Visuals of Tick Marks
description: You can configure the color, transparency, height, and thickness of both, major and minor tick marks.

title: Add External Logo
description: You can load external logos at runtime with can be GIF/JPEG/PNG or SWF files. This section talks about configuring and linking the logo to an external URL

title: Add an External Logo
description: To add an external logo specify the URL of the logo using the logoURL attribute.

title: Configure the External Logo
description: To configure the external logo, the following attributes are used:

title: Link Logo to an External URL
description: To add an external link to the logo, specify the external link using the logoLink attribute.

title: Chart Paddings and Margins
description: FusionCharts Suite XT lets you manage the space around the canvas and within the chart by configuring chart paddings and margins.

title: Set Chart Margins
description: Chart margin is the space between the chart border and the canvas border. You can set the chart margins on any one of the chart's four sides. To do so, the following attributes are used:

title: Set Padding for Caption
description: Set the amount of empty space between the sub-caption and the top of the chart canvas using the captionPadding attribute. Refer to the code below:

title: Set Padding for Axes Names
description: Set the axis name padding and axis value padding, to control the amount of space between the axes and the canvas. To do so, the following attributes are used:

title: Set Padding for Axis Values
description: Specify the amount of horizontal space between the left edge of the canvas and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side) using the yAxisValuePadding attribute.

title: Set Padding for Data Label
description: Specify the vertical space between the canvas bottom edge and the data labels using the labelPadding attribute.

title: Set Padding for Data Value
description: Specify the space between the columns/anchors and the value text boxes using the valuePadding attribute.

title: Set Canvas Padding
description: For a line/area chart, canvas padding is the space between the canvas border and the position where the line/area chart begins. Specify the amount of gap using the canvasPadding attribute.

title: Toolbar
description: The advantage of toolbar is it manages all the UI action elements centrally, providing a uniform look and a better meaningful and logical grouping.

title: Drill-down
description: Using FusionCharts Suite XT, you can create endless levels of drilldown. It has been kept very generic to accommodate all types of requirements.

title: Simple links
description: Drill-down to open simple URLs or call JavaScript functions (defined within the same page), which can open in the same page, a new page, or a specified frame/popup window. You can also use these links to render the entire chart as a hotspot.In the section below, you can see how to define simple links that open in different target locations.

title: Chart links (Linked Charts)
description: Drill down to detailed linked charts that show data at different levels of detail.

title: Introduction to Themes
description: A theme file lets you centralize the visual appearance, behavior and intelligence aspects for a chart, gauge, or map.

title: Theme Manager
description: You can choose a theme depending on your aesthetic requirements for the charts, gauges, and maps in your application.

title: Apply a theme to your chart
description: To apply a theme to your chart, include its corresponding JavaScript file in your web page.

title: Use the theme attribute
description: In the following code snippet, you can see how to use the theme attribute to apply a theme:

title: Modify existing themes
description: To modify an existing theme, all you need to do is add/update the required attribute-value pair(s) in the JavaScript file of the theme. You can do this for any number of attributes.

title: Create Your Own Themes
description: FusionCharts Suite XT is shipped with the following three predefined themes zune, ocean and carbon.

title: Create and register multiple themes
description: If you need to create multiple new themes for your application, then ideally you should include all theme definitions in the same file. That way, you will have to include only one .js file in your application, instead of multiple files. You can then change the theme name, as the value of the theme attribute, or as the parameter of the setChartAttribute() method.

title: Include escape characters in theme definition
description: You can include escape characters in definitions for new themes using the same process as the one you follow to include them when modifying existing themes. The process is detailed here.

title: Building a Dashboard

title: Using currency symbols
description: Currency symbols like the, (Pound), (Euro), (Yen) etc., may also be a part of the data which is displayed on charts. To display these characters on a chart, you can simply include it in the XML/JSON data source of the chart. This is applicable in both Data URL and Data String methods.

title: Using special characters
description: You can directly embed most of the special characters and punctuation marks in the XML/JSON data source of your chart. However some characters like & , < , > , ' (apostrophe) and " (quote) need to be specially encoded when providing the same as a part of the chart data. Apart from this, there is no need to encode any other special character.

title: Connecting Null Data
description: In our above Line chart, we were showing a break for the months of May and June. If you do not want to show this break for May and Jun, and want April to directly connect to July, you can do so using the connectNullData attribute.

title: Highlight Specific Data Points
description: To help user visualize data, it is often necessary for you to highlight one or more data points in a chart.

title: Changing the Color of an Individual Data Point
description: A plot with a distinctly different color stands out of a set of uniformly colored data plots. This is the easiest and most prominent way to highlight a data plot. But, this technique fails in case different colors are used on different data plots.

title: Highlighting the Data Point by changing its Alpha and using Dashed Border
description: This is a more subtle way to highlight a data plot, where you may not prefer to colorize the plot with a distinctly different color. Change the plot opacity and you get a color derivative of the original color. If thats not enough as a highlighter, make the border dashed to add weight and help the plot stand out in the show.

title: Changing Anchor Properties in charts like Line and Area
description: Anchors represent data points in charts that lack data plots to represent numerical data. Charts plotting line or area or both (as in combination charts) fall in this category. Spline charts fall in this category either. In a nutshell, if you have line, spline or area plots in any chart and you need to highlight data points on any of these, use anchors if not yet and highlight the required data plot.

title: How FusionTime Works
description: This article defines the flow of FusionTime.

title: How FusionTime is different from FusionCharts
description: While FusionCharts can help you visualize data in dozens of different ways, FusionTime works exclusively with time series data. Unlike other varieties of charts in FusionCharts, which only (till now) accept data in JSON/XML, FusionTime accepts data in rows and columns as a Datatable. You can then apply different data operations (filter, grouping, etc.) on the DataTable to optimize your data as per the requirement.

title: FusionTime Data Layer
description: FusionTime data layer is comprised of a DataStore and a DataTable. So, how do you create the DataTable? The FusionTime data layer comes with a DataStore which accepts data in JSON/2D array format. The data fed in the DataStore is converted to a root DataTable. This root DataTable contains the source data in a tabular format.

title: Overview
description: This article outlines the DataStore and DataTable.

title: What is DataStore?
description: DataStore is an in-browser store of tabular data. Mainly, the DataStore contains the DataTable derived from the original data source along with some data operations. You can then perform data operations on this DataTable to transform the data as per your requirement. For any operation applied a new DataTable is generated keeping the source data intact.

title: What is a DataTable?
description: The tabular representation of the data is called the DataTable, which is stored in the DataStore. You can apply one or more operations to an existing DataTable to create a new table with the resulting data.

title: Attributes
description: This article contains the list of fusion time attributes.

title: Time Axis
description:
Attribute	Type	Description
plot	String	Defines the column, which will be plotted along this axis.
timeMarker	Array(Time Marker Configuration)	Array of TimeMarkerConfigs that will be shown along the axis.

title: Time Markers
description:
Attribute	Type	Description
label	String	Sets the label of the time marker.
start	String	Sets the start time of the marker. Corresponds to the start of the date/time.
end	String	Sets the end time of the marker. If this is attribute is not specified, the marker is represented as a line and not as a band. Corresponds to the end of the given date/time.
timeFormat	String	Sets the date/time format and specifies the start and end values for the time marker.
unit	String	Defines the time unit for the time marker.
multiplier	Number	Sets the multiplier of the time unit. Default is 1.
type	String	Setting this attribute to full will render the time marker (instance & band) from top to bottom (vertically) of the canvas.

title: Y Axes
description:
Attribute	Type	Description
plot	String, Array of Strings, Array of Objects	It maps to the column header for the measure which is plotted against the Y Axis. If it's an array of strings, all the strings are plotted against the same axis. If its an array of objects, the developer can additionally specify the type of the plot as well as the aggregation strategy used to represent the measure.
plotType	String	This attribute sets the type of the the data plot to render the chart. By default the type is a line. It controls the plot type for all names specified.
min	Number	This attribute sets the minimum value of the axis. The value of this attribute is ignored when the value is greater than the minimum value of the data plotted against the axis.
max	Number	This attribute sets the maximum value of the axis. The value of this attribute is ignored when the value is less than the maximum value of the data plotted against the axis.
format	String	This attribute sets the configuration of the measures plotted on the axis. If you set the formatter function, the provided prefix and suffix properties are ignored.
title	String	Allows you to rename the title of the axis. If not specified, the axis title will be the same as the column name joined by hyphens.
aggregation	String	Allows you to specify alternative aggregation strategies for the measures being plotted. It controls the aggregation strategy for all plots specified.
type	String	This attribute sets the type of the the data plot to render the chart. It is used when you want to specify the chart type under plot object.

title: Plot Configuration
description:
Attributes	Type	Description
generic	Object	Style specified within this object is applied across the chart.
connectNullData	Boolean	Connects the null data for line and area plots.

title: Reference Lines
description:
Attribute	Type	Description
label	String	The label which gets displayed when you hover the reference lines.
value	Number	This attribute specifies the value at which the reference line is drawn.

title: Data Markers
description:
Attribute	Type	Description
seriesName	String	This attribute specifies the name of the series on which the data marker will be displayed. If the series is specified as a combination of a series name as well as a measure name, it should be in <series_name>-<measure_name> format.
time	String	Sets the time on which the data marker will be shown. Corresponds to the start of the given date/time.
timeFormat	String	Sets the format of the date to specify the time for the marker.
type	String	Sets the type of the marker. Example, flag.
identifier	Character	This attribute defines a character to be shown within the data marker.
tooltext	String	The text specified in this attribute is displayed in the tooltip when you hover over the data marker.

title: Date/time Format
description: outputFormat attribute is used to set the format of the column being grouped. To set the date/time format of the chart, set the value of outputFormat attribute as per your requirement.

title: Types of filters
description: The predefined filters are:

title: Null
description: Null is a filter operator which can be used to find any Null data.

title: Not Null
description: Null is a filter operator which can be used to find all the data except the Null data.

title: Equal
description: Equals is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter specific data value.

title: Not Equal
description: Not Equals is a filter operator operation which can be used when you want to omit some specific data value.

title: Greater
description: Greater is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter the data values greater than a specific numeric value.

title: Greater or Equal
description: This filter operator is similar to greater filter which can be used when you want to filter the data values greater than a specific numeric value. Greater or Equal operation is used when you want to filter the data values greater and equal to the specific value.

title: Less
description: Less is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter the data values less than a specific numeric value.

title: Less or Equal
description: This filter operator is similar to less filter which can be used when you want to filter the data values less than a specific numeric value. Less or equal operation is used when you want to filter the data values less and equal to the specific value.

title: Between
description: Between is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter the data between specific date/time or value.

title: Begins with
description: Begins with is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter a string data which begins with a specific string value.

title: Contains
description: Contains is a filter operator which can be used when you want search specific data using a particular string value.

title: Ends with
description: Ends with is a filter operator which can be used when you want to filter a string data which ends with a specific string value.

description: FusionCharts DataEngine supports logical operators which filters the data based on some condition. In this section we will discuss about:

title: Types of Sort

title: Ascending Order
description: When you sort one or more columns of a tabular data in ascending order, the data will be arranged from the lowest to the highest values. FusionCharts.Net by default sorts data in ascending order.

title: Descending Order
description: When you sort one or more columns of a tabular data in descending order, the data will be arranged from the highest to the lowest values.
